medicine noun
(SUBSTANCE)
A2 [ C or U ] a substance, especially in the form of a liquid or a pill, that is a treatment for illness or injury: cough medicine Take two spoonfuls of medicine at mealtimes. She knows a lot about herbal medicines.
More examplesFewer examplesThis medicine is for external use only and should not be taken internally.Is this medicine safe for children?The little boy was stamping his foot and refusing to take his medicine.The trucks were laden with food and medicine.This drug can be safely used in combination with other medicines.
